title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.15.47-48 | 03-01-2023
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: This is very significant that the Pandavas went back to Godhead in the self-same body.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces verses 47 and 48 of the 15th chapter of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam, explaining that pure devotees like the Pandavas can attain the spiritual sky and even return to Godhead in their same bodies due to their constant devotional remembrance of Krishna.

segments.key_quote: Srila Jiva Goswami says, a person freed from the three modes of material qualities, goodness, passion and ignorance, and situated in transcendence, can reach the highest perfection of life without change of body.
segments.summary: The speaker quotes Srila Jiva Goswami and Sanatana Goswami, explaining that freedom from the three modes of material nature and engaging in pure devotional service under the guidance of a bona fide spiritual master allows one to attain perfection and even the status of a twice-born brahmana.

segments.key_quote: It is therefore the actual guidance that matters in the process of becoming a brahmana, even without change of body, or in going back to Godhead without change of body.
segments.summary: Using the analogy of turning bell-metal into gold through alchemy, the speaker emphasizes the importance of sadhana bhakti under the expert guidance of a bona fide spiritual master for purification and attaining the perfection of a brahmana, potentially even without changing the body.

segments.key_quote: Pure devotional service is only possible on the Brahman platform, on the spiritual platform.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that the word 'he' in the verse affirms the possibility of returning to Godhead without changing the body through pure devotional service, which is only possible on the Brahman platform, leading to the attainment of Koloka Vrindavana.

segments.key_quote: Even if we practice constant chanting of Hare Krishna, Hare Krishna, Krishna Krishna, Hare Hare, Hare Rama, Hare Rama, Rama Rama, Hare Hare, then we don't have to change our body.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by explaining that Lord Krishna always remains in his transcendental form and that pure devotees, through constant engagement in devotional service, especially chanting the Hare Krishna mantra, can spiritualize their bodies and potentially avoid changing them at the time of death.
